intro: Alyxia glaucophylla, commonly known as the silver-leaf alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent, fleshy corona. Alyxia glaucophylla is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in sunny, open habitats.
